conclusion: Consider forces on both straight and curved parts of the wire frame.
The straight part of the wire frame experiences an Ampere force F.
The curved part of the wire frame also experiences an Ampere force to be calculated.
The curved part is a semi-circle with radius r and length πr.
Current through the curved part is the same as through the straight part, and the magnetic field is uniform.
Force on a segment in a magnetic field is F = I L B.
For the curved part, the effective length contributing to the force is the entire length πr.
Force on the curved part is F_curved = I (πr) B.
Force on the straight part is F = I (2r) B.
Total force is the vector sum of forces on straight and curved parts.
Substitute expressions: F_total = I (2r) B + I (πr) B.
Given F = I (2r) B, express F_total in terms of F.
Final answer: Magnitude of Ampere force is (2/π) F.
